text: The Red Line () or Orient Line () is one of the four lines of the Lisbon Metro. == Stations == {|class=wikitable !rowspan=2|Code!!rowspan=2|Station name!! colspan="2" | Distance (km)!! rowspan="2" |Transfers!!rowspan=2 colspan="2" |Location |- ! Headway |- | Working days | style="vertical-align: top;" | 06:30 - 07:10 07:10 - 09:45 09:45 - 16:30 16:30 - 19:15 19:15 - 20:30 20:30 - 22:30 22:30 - 01:05 | style="vertical-align: top;" | 09' 45" 06' 15" 07' 00" 06' 15" 07' 05" 07' 55" 09' 25"' | style="vertical-align: top;" |06:30 - 07:10 07:10 - 09:15 09:15 - 16:30 16:30 - 19:15 19:15 - 20:30 20:30 - 22:30 22:30 - 01:05 | style="vertical-align: top;" |09' 45" 06' 15" 07' 00" 06' 15" 07' 05" 07' 55" 09' 25" |- | Weekends and holidays | 06:30 - 22:15 22:15 - 00:00 00:00 - 01:05 | 08' 00' 09' 35" 09' 25" | 06:30 - 22:15 22:15 - 00:00 00:00 - 01:05 | 08' 00' 09' 35" 09' 25" |- |} ==Chronology== *May 19, 1998: Opening of the red line with the following stations: Alameda, Olaias, Bela Vista, Chelas and Oriente. *July 18, 1998: Opening of the Cabo Ruivo station. *November 7, 1998: Opening of the Olivais station. *August 29, 2009: Opening of the Saldanha and São Sebastião stations. Line route: São Sebastião - Oriente. *July 17, 2012: Opening of the Moscavide, Encarnação and Aeroporto stations. Line route: São Sebastião - Aeroporto. ==See also== * List of Lisbon metro stations ==References== ==External links== Category:Lisbon Metro Category:Railway lines opened in 1998
title: Red Line (Lisbon Metro)
